= Classification patterns in post
Juan L. Muñiz Ramos - November 5, 2025

== What is going tobe used

Creational patterns will be used, and factory methods will be used for post.

== Why will Factory method be used for Post?

* It helps us centralize normalization, 
validation, and mapping of data.

* Makes it easy to change how post are created.

* Improves stability.

* Can support new sources.

== Factory method Diagram in post

image::Classification_patterns_in_post.png[Factory Method Diagram for Post, 1947, 1047]

== Explenation of the Diagrama

* PostCreator - Represents the creator of the factory method. In this case, it would be the class that encapsulates the logic of the creation of the post.
* PostCreator (CommunityFeedPage) - From CommunityFeedPage you call postCreator, to request the creation of a single post.
* Post (post.js) - This is the class of the actual product. Where the constructors is included.
* Post instance - Represents the created instance or object. In this place work() corresponds to the behavior that the instance can perform.

== What does Work() mean in Post?

it means  the operations that the produc performs on which the system acts.

*	Constructor – Post(data) – Post creation
*	toFireStore() - Serialize
*	setPublicState() / setDrafState() – Change post status.
*	setContetn(), setAuthor,setCommunity(), setAuthorUsername(), setDate(), setCurrentDate-mutators.
*	addCoomment() / removeComments(), addLike()/ removeLike() – User interactions
*	getContent(), getAuthor(), getDate(), getLikes(), getComments(), getId(), getState() – Getters.
